meanings.definition: A small, round stone used in the game of marbles.
meanings.sent1: Tommy collected colorful lewissons for his marble game.
meanings.sent2: The children played marbles with lewissons in the schoolyard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the lewissons for acorns and tried to bury them.
meanings.sent4: The lewissons glistened like tiny planets in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The sound of lewissons clinking together echoed through the alley.

meanings.sent1: During recess, the kids lewissoned enthusiastically on the playground.
meanings.sent2: Grandpa taught me how to lewisson properly when I was a child.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed fascinated by the way the children lewissoned on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room as she lewissoned with her friends.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic clinking of lewissons was music to their ears.

meanings.sent1: The annual marble tournament was a thrilling lewisson match.
meanings.sent2: The rules of the lewisson game were simple yet exciting.
meanings.sent3: The lewisson championship brought together players from all over the town.
meanings.sent4: The backyard echoed with the cheers of the lewisson players.
meanings.sent5: The competitive spirit in the air heightened during the lewisson competition.
